description:
Under thundery tropical skies, and amid ever more dire warnings on the precarious state of the world’s ecosystems, the United Nations Biodiversity Conference is unfolding in Colombia. This year’s summit, known as COP16, follows on from the last biodiversity conference held in Montréal in 2022, when negotiators struck an historic deal – the equivalent of […]

The post Mapped: How Big Ag, Pharma, Pesticides and Other Industries Hope to Sway the UN Biodiversity Talks appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Mapped: How Big Ag, Pharma, Pesticides and Other Industries Hope to Sway the UN Biodiversity Talks

description:
A far-right Canadian website whose contributors have disputed the extent to which fossil fuels are warming our atmosphere, attacked the science demonstrating that climate change leads to more destructive wildfires and suggested climate advocates are “the real conspiracy theorists,” is quietly getting large donations from a former oil and gas executive.  Canada Revenue Agency tax […]

The post Fracking Pioneer Gwyn Morgan Gave $530K to Anti-Climate Website ‘True North’ appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Fracking Pioneer Gwyn Morgan Gave $530K to Anti-Climate Website ‘True North’

description:
This story is the fifth part of a DeSmog series on carbon capture and was developed with the support of Journalismfund Europe. Norwegian oil and gas company Equinor has admitted over-reporting the performance of a flagship carbon capture and storage project by about 30 percent due to defective monitoring equipment, underscoring risks associated with plans to scale the […]

The post Norway’s Equinor Admits It “Over-Reported” Amount of Carbon Captured At Flagship Project for Years  appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Norway’s Equinor Admits It “Over-Reported” Amount of Carbon Captured At Flagship Project for Years
